title.value: Trade-off between accuracy and fairness of data-driven building and indoor environment models: A comparative study of pre-processing methods
title.justification: The title precisely reflects the core focus and content of the paper, specifically looking at the balance between accuracy and fairness in models used within building environments.
title.quote: Trade-off between accuracy and fairness of data-driven building and indoor environment models: A comparative study of pre-processing methods

extractions.description: The paper investigates fairness-aware prediction in data-driven building and indoor environment models, proposing and testing different pre-processing methods to balance accuracy and fairness.

type.justification: The paper focuses on empirical studies of predictive models and pre-processing methods.
type.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.

name.justification: The paper specifically focuses on data-driven models in the context of building and indoor environments.
name.quote: Data-driven models have drawn extensive attention in the building domain in recent years.

name.justification: A significant part of the paper is dedicated to fairness in predictive modeling.
name.quote: This paper addresses a new research problem called fairness-aware prediction of data-driven building and indoor environment models.

name.justification: The paper discusses data-driven modeling in buildings.
name.quote: Data-driven models have drawn extensive attention in the building domain in recent years.

name.justification: Sequential Sampling is described as a pre-processing method proposed in the paper to improve fairness Type II.
name.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_contributed.justification: Sequential Sampling is one of the methods proposed in this research.
is_contributed.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_executed.justification: No indication that the method requires GPU/CPU execution processes such as training standard deep learning models.
is_executed.quote: Overall, 576 study cases were used to study the effect of these pre-processing methods on the accuracy and fairness of 12 series of lighting status prediction based on 2 types of feature combinations and 4 types of classifiers.

is_compared.justification: The method was compared to existing pre-processing methods in terms of fairness and accuracy.
is_compared.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.

referenced_paper_title.justification: Sequential Sampling is introduced as a novel contribution in this paper, not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

name.justification: Reversed Preferential Sampling is proposed for improving fairness Type II in models.
name.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_contributed.justification: This method is introduced in the scope of this paper.
is_contributed.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_executed.justification: It is a pre-processing method, not a machine learning algorithm executed in the traditional sense.
is_executed.quote: Overall, 576 study cases were used to study the effect of these pre-processing methods on the accuracy and fairness of 12 series of lighting status prediction based on 2 types of feature combinations and 4 types of classifiers.

is_compared.justification: The method's performance was compared to other pre-processing methods in their study.
is_compared.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The method is presented as an original contribution within the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

name.justification: Sequential Preferential Sampling is one of the methods created for better fairness Type II.
name.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_contributed.justification: The method is developed as part of this study.
is_contributed.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

is_executed.justification: Being a pre-processing strategy, it lacks typical execution demands such as those on a GPU.
is_executed.quote: Overall, 576 study cases were used to study the effect of these pre-processing methods on the accuracy and fairness of 12 series of lighting status prediction based on 2 types of feature combinations and 4 types of classifiers.

is_compared.justification: Its effectiveness was evaluated against other pre-processing strategies.
is_compared.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.

referenced_paper_title.justification: As a novel strategy, it is not drawn from another publication.
referenced_paper_title.quote: To improve fairness Type II while preserving the predictive accuracy of data-driven building and indoor environment models, we propose three pre-processing methods for training datasetdsequential sampling, reversed preferential sampling, and sequential preferential sampling.

name.justification: The dataset is used for studying the effect of pre-processing methods on lighting status predictions.
name.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is used in the case study but not referenced from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The proposed methods are compared to two existing pre-processing methods in a case study for lighting status prediction in an apartment building.
